section.title: drogon_ctl Command
section.paragraph: After the Drogon framework is compiled and installed, a command line program drogon_ctl is also installed in the system, for convenience, also installed an identical copy dg_ctl. Users can choose according to their preferences.
The main function of the program is to make it easy for users to create various drogon project files. Use the dg_ctl help command to see the functions it supports, as follows:
section.literal_block: dg_ctl help usage: drogon_ctl <command> [<args>] commands list: create create some source files(Use 'drogon_ctl help create' for more information) help display this message version display version of this tool press Do stress testing(Use 'drogon_ctl help press' for more information)

section.title: Create sub command
section.paragraph: The create subcommand is used to create various objects. It is currently the main function of drogon_ctl. Use the dg_ctl help create command to print detailed help for this command, as follows:
section.literal_block:
dg_ctl help create
Use create command to create some source files of drogon webapp
Usage:drogon_ctl create <view|controller|filter|project|model> [-options] <object name>
drogon_ctl create view <csp file name> //create HttpView source files from csp file
drogon_ctl create controller [-s] <[namespace::]class_name> //create HttpSimpleController source files
drogon_ctl create controller -h <[namespace::]class_name> //create HttpController source files
drogon_ctl create controller -w <[namespace::]class_name> //create WebSocketController source files
drogon_ctl create filter <[namespace::]class_name> //create a filter named class_name
drogon_ctl create project <project_name> //create a project named project_name
drogon_ctl create model <model_path> //create model classes in model_path

section.title: Controller creation
section.paragraph: The dg_ctl create controller command is used to help the user create the controller’s source files. The three controllers currently supported by drogon can be created by this command.

list_item.paragraph: The command to create an HttpSimpleController is as follows:

block_quote.literal_block: dg_ctl create controller SimpleControllerTest dg_ctl create controller webapp::v1::SimpleControllerTest

section.paragraph: The last parameter is the controller’s class name, which can be prefixed by a namespace.

list_item.paragraph: The command to create an HttpController is as follows:

block_quote.literal_block: dg_ctl create controller -h ControllerTest dg_ctl create controller -h api::v1::ControllerTest

list_item.paragraph: The command to create a WebSocketController is as follows:

block_quote.literal_block: dg_ctl create controller -w WsControllerTest dg_ctl create controller -w api::v1::WsControllerTest

section.title: Filter creation
section.paragraph: The dg_ctl create filter command is used to help the user create the source files for filters, see the Filter section.
section.literal_block: dg_ctl create filter LoginFilter dg_ctl create filter webapp::v1::LoginFilter

section.title: Create project
section.paragraph: The best way the user creates a new Drogon application project is via the drogon_ctl command, as follows:

After the command is executed, a complete project directory will be created in the current directory. The directory name is ProjectName, and the user can directly compile the project in the build directory (cmake .. && make). Of course, it does not have any business logic.
The directory structure of the project is as follows:
section.literal_block: ├── build Build folder ├── CMakeLists.txt Project cmake configuration file ├── cmake_modules Cmake scripts for third-party libraries lookup │ ├── FindJsoncpp.cmake │ ├── FindMySQL.cmake │ ├── FindSQLite3.cmake │ └── FindUUID.cmake ├── config.json The configuration file of the drogon application, please refer to the introduction section of the configuration file. ├── controllers The directory where the controller source files are stored ├── filters The directory where the filter files are stored ├── main.cc Main program ├── models The directory of the database model file, model source file creation see 11.2.5 │ └── model.json └── views The directory where view csp files are stored, the source file does not need to be manually created by the user, and csp files are automatically preprocessed to obtain view source files when the project is compiled.

section.title: Stress Testing
section.paragraph: One can use the dg_ctl press command to do a stress testing, there are several options for this command.

list_item.paragraph: -n num Set the number of requests(default : 1)
-t num Set the number of threads(default : 1), Set the number to the number of CPUs to achieve maximum performance
-c num Set the number of concurrent connections(default : 1)

section.paragraph: For example, users can test an HTTP server as follows:
section.literal_block: dg_ctl press -n1000000 -t4 -c1000 -q http://localhost:8080/ dg_ctl press -n 1000000 -t 4 -c 1000 https://www.domain.com/path/to/be/tested
